security: Disclosing the bank account details of an individual involved in covert operations could expose the individual to risk and compromise ongoing or future operations. Quoting directly: "The check for the $2,000 operational advance was drawn on a check of the cover company...should be deposited to his Commercial Account."
summary: This memo details the bank account information for Edward G. Tichborn, including the Bank of America branch and instructions for depositing operational advances and salary payments to his Commercial Account.
summary_one_paragraph: This memorandum, dated January 19, 1960, outlines the banking details for Edward G. Tichborn, instructing that checks for operational advances, such as the $2,000 advance drawn on a cover company check and mailed from Washington on January 15, 1960, along with salary payments (specifically, a $650 check representing Â¼ of his total salary), should be mailed to his Bank of America account at the Wilshire-Sweetzer Branch in Los Angeles, California, and credited to his Commercial Account.
title: Edward G. Tichborn's Bank Account Details
